name: Enable automatic minor version upgrades for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Ensure that automatic minor version upgrades are enabled on all Amazon MQ brokers to receive the latest security patches and bug fixes automatically.

name: Enable audit logging for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Enable audit logging for all Amazon MQ brokers to track and monitor broker actions, configuration changes, and access attempts.

name: Use AWS KMS Customer Managed Key (CMK) for Amazon MQ broker encryption
description: Ensure that all Amazon MQ brokers are encrypted using a Customer Managed Key (CMK) from AWS Key Management Service (KMS) for enhanced control over the encryption process.

name: Disable public accessibility for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Ensure that all Amazon MQ brokers are not publicly accessible and are only reachable from within the VPC or through authorized VPN connections.

name: Enable general logging for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Enable general logging for all Amazon MQ brokers to capture information about broker operations, connections, and message flows for troubleshooting and monitoring purposes.

name: Keep Amazon MQ brokers updated to the latest major version
description: Regularly update Amazon MQ brokers to the latest major version to ensure access to the most recent features, performance improvements, and security enhancements.

name: Use VPC peering or AWS PrivateLink for Amazon MQ broker access
description: Configure VPC peering or AWS PrivateLink to enable secure, private access to Amazon MQ brokers from other VPCs or on-premises networks without exposing the brokers to the public internet.

name: Implement least privilege access for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Ensure that IAM policies granting access to Amazon MQ brokers follow the principle of least privilege, providing only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for managing and accessing the brokers.

name: Enable encryption in transit for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Ensure that all Amazon MQ brokers have encryption in transit enabled, using the latest supported TLS version, to protect data communications between clients and brokers.

name: Configure Amazon MQ brokers in a multi-AZ deployment
description: Deploy Amazon MQ brokers in a multi-Availability Zone configuration to enhance high availability and fault tolerance for critical messaging workloads.

name: Implement Amazon MQ broker network access control
description: Configure security groups and network ACLs to control inbound and outbound traffic to Amazon MQ brokers, allowing access only from authorized sources on required ports.

name: Enable CloudWatch monitoring for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Configure CloudWatch monitoring for all Amazon MQ brokers to track performance metrics, set up alarms for abnormal behavior, and ensure optimal operation of the messaging system.

name: Implement message persistence for Amazon MQ brokers
description: Configure message persistence for Amazon MQ brokers to ensure that messages are not lost in case of broker restarts or failures, enhancing data durability and reliability.

name: Use strong authentication mechanisms for Amazon MQ broker access
description: Implement strong authentication mechanisms, such as username and password with complexity requirements or LDAP authentication, for accessing Amazon MQ brokers to prevent unauthorized access.

name: Regularly rotate Amazon MQ broker credentials
description: Implement a process to regularly rotate credentials (usernames and passwords) used for accessing Amazon MQ brokers to minimize the risk of unauthorized access due to compromised credentials.
